head.title: Night of the Living? Dead Photos

hedline.hl1: Night of the Living? Dead Photos

block.p: The current Manhattan Halloween celebration began in the early 70's, when East Village artists created a parade for their families. It wandered over cobblestone streets to Washington Square, as costumed spectators hung from windows. By 1985 the homemade enchantment vanished among the crowds. Now that charm can be seen in cobweb-draped Victorians in Chelsea. The decorative urge has even spread to a few East Side town houses.

The current Manhattan Halloween celebration began in the early 70's, when East Village artists created a parade for their families. It wandered over cobblestone streets to Washington Square, as costumed spectators hung from windows. By 1985 the homemade enchantment vanished among the crowds. Now that charm can be seen in cobweb-draped Victorians in Chelsea. The decorative urge has even spread to a few East Side town houses. ON THE STREET
